title: 114_hr5922
content: The Act titled "Saving Federal Dollars Through Better Use of Government Purchase and Travel Cards Act of 2016" defines terms like "improper payment" and "questionable transaction" to address issues related to government spending. It also introduces the concept of "strategic sourcing" to improve purchasing power and reduce costs in Federal agencies. The Act "Saving Federal Dollars Through Better Use of Government Purchase and Travel Cards Act of 2016" mandates the development of a strategy to expand data analytics in managing government purchase and travel charge card programs. This includes identifying questionable transactions, recovering improper payments, leveraging cost reduction opportunities, and developing metrics for purchase and travel card usage. The strategy mandated by the Act aims to leverage cost reduction opportunities through administrative process streamlining and card-based strategic sourcing. It also involves developing metrics for high-risk activities and creating a library of analytics tools for Federal agencies to use. SEC. 4. GUIDANCE ON IMPROVING INFORMATION SHARING TO CURB IMPROPER PAYMENTS. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget, in consultation with relevant agencies, will issue guidance to improve information sharing among government agencies to identify high-risk activities, review reports on questionable transactions, and facilitate the sharing of information. The Director will issue guidance to improve information sharing among government agencies to identify high-risk activities, review reports on questionable transactions, and facilitate sharing of information, including transactions with suspicious timing or amounts of cash withdrawals. Sharing information related to potential fraud schemes and high-risk activities with the General Services Administration Office of Charge Card Management and Federal agencies is also required. Other necessary requirements will be determined by the Director for the Act's implementation. SEC. 5. INTERAGENCY CHARGE CARD DATA MANAGEMENT GROUP. The Administrator of General Services and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget will establish a purchase and travel charge card data management group to develop best practices related to charge card-issuing banks, account payable information, and identifying strategic sourcing opportunities. The group will meet regularly for three years and include relevant agencies. The purchase and travel charge card data management group, established by the Administrator of General Services and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, will meet regularly for three years and include relevant agencies as described in the Government Charge Card Abuse Prevention Act of 2012. SEC. 6. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. The General Services Administration and Federal agencies must submit reports on the implementation of the Act, including metrics for reducing improper payments and improving card-based payment utilization. The Office of Management and Budget will consolidate agency reports and submit a report to Congress. The Administrator of General Services will submit a report to Congress within one year of the Act's enactment, identifying additional savings opportunities for government agencies under the Federal charge card programs. This report may be combined with other reports required by the Act.
